data.title: Walgreens Boots Alliance on LinkedIn: #wearewba
data.meta_description: Today our CEO, Tim Wentworth, and Board of Directors announced leadership changes to our Executive Committee as we look to advance a health services strategy… | 57 comments on LinkedIn
data.text:
If you are an MBE, there are great corporations out there willing to help you get your first shot, and grow your business. This video, tells our story of how many great companies, and great people gave us a shot, and continued to pour time and energy into us. Our businesses have worked with 30+ Fortune 500 CLIENTS. Not just jobs... but CLIENTS. This video is in honor of my dad, Darrell Ortiz, who gave everything of himself to help others his entire life. We lost him last summer, but his legacy lives on in my family and our businesses. Corporate Buyers and Leaders, this video explains how you have the chance to leave a legacy by being willing to stick your neck out and give someone their first shot... and then understanding it might take a little time for them to figure things out. But when they do, you'll have a loyal partner that will do amazing things for you. Featured in this video Chicago Minority Supplier Development Council Chicago United Rona Fourté Kate Kiselyk Dave Thomas Jose M Robles-Michelena Nicor Gas Walgreens ComEd Stay tuned for more videos that feature the 5 great Subcontractors that we are mentoring, and learn how we are working with them, on actual corporate projects, so they too can grow their businesses, profitably, through partnerships, and not simply low bid. Thanks to our other corporate client partners as well JPMorgan Chase & Co. Exelon Mondelēz International PNC Chick-fil-A Corporate Support Center McDonald's DaVita Kidney Care Harrah's Joliet Casino & Hotel JLL CBRE WEC Energy Group Union Pacific Railroad University of Chicago UChicago Medicine PepsiCo BMO U.S. BMO #goodpeoplewhocare #supplierdiversity #people #chicago #leaders #business National Minority Supplier Development Council (NMSDCHQ)

Career Tips for Young Professionals – It’s been a privilege to work alongside Christina Oh during her tenure as Trident Health’s President and CEO. As she prepares for her new job as President of the San Francisco Bay Market for Sutter Health, following are some of the most impactful lessons I learned from her: 1. Asking someone their name is good manners. Remembering it is transformational. 2. Creating a workplace environment where colleagues have a voice and a future is an investment in the future. 3. Like a major league baseball team, always look for the next generation of leaders who can be encouraged, developed and promoted. 4. Individual and group commitments and accountability are critical to creating a unified team of leaders. 5. By honoring an uncompromising commitment to each patient, it’s possible to consistently deliver high quality, compassionate care to a large patient population that is increasingly in need of complex medical care. Christina leaves Trident in good hands. As a result of her leadership, we’ll continue her vision of expanding access to high quality, compassionate care throughout South Carolina’s Lowcountry and beyond. #hcahealthare #sutterhealth #integrity #leader

The Senior Executives Association released a statement on the Presidential Rank Award winners. President Marcus L. Hill stated, “SEA enthusiastically applauds President Biden’s selection of 232 Presidential Rank Award (PRA) recipients, representing over 31 federal agencies. These career federal executives and senior professionals have earned the President’s recognition through their sustained, extraordinary performances over time. Their leadership contributions in achieving mission successes and positive outcomes for the American public are unmatched,” Hill said. “SEA applauds President Biden for recognizing excellence within the career, senior executive service, and is pleased federal agencies are nominating exceptional individuals to be considered for this prestigious award. The accomplishments of the Presidential Rank Awardees demonstrate the meaningful impact of excellence in service." Read the full statement at https://lnkd.in/g2J2Jait SEA also recognizes five members of the organization who were recipients of this prestigious award. Congratulations to Troy Mueller, Stuart Bender, Richard Aldridge, Anne Kinsinger, and Kevin Tokarski for their achievement. #seniorexecutives #presidentialrankawards #award #leadership #government #governmentaffairs #publicservice #seniorofficial #governmentagencies #federalworkforce #governmentemployees

What lessons can we learn from this leadership change at Walgreens Boots Alliance? 1) When you are not reaching your financial targets, it is necessary to pivot your strategy 2) Your employees' skills need to align with your strategic goals 3) Invest time into finding the right talent Rosalind Brewer is a highly accomplished leader, but she and Walgreens decided she is not the leader the organization needs to achieve its new goals. Staffing changes typically have less to do with the individual and more with the job that needs to be done. Sometimes, the best thing you can do for your organization is to replace a good employee with an employee who better fits your goals. While challenging, this can be a good thing for employees because it allows them to find an opportunity to utilize their skills and potential better. I look forward to seeing where Rosalind will land. Wherever it is, I anticipate her making a positive impact. #pivot #leadership #transition #resilience https://lnkd.in/ewBhXVis

Happy Mother's Day to all the amazing moms out there! As we celebrate this special day, let's take a moment to thank the women who shaped us into who we are today. Behind every great person is a great mom. At S.T.A.R Procurement, we know the importance of strong leadership and the impact it can have on our teams. We want to give a shoutout to all the amazing moms who are also CEOs, CFOs, COOs, managing directors, directors, board members, chairmen, founders, and GMs. Your hard work and dedication inspire us every day. As we head into the weekend, let's remember to be safe and kind to each other. Life is too short not to spread love and positivity. #HappyMothersDay #Leadership #Procurement #Team #SupplyChain #Logistics #AgedCareAustralia #RetirementHome #QSRs #FranchiseBusiness #NotForProfit #FMCGIndustry #CleaningServices #ConstructionIndustry #FacilitiesManagement #MiningIndustry #Infrastructure #Resourcing #GovernmentContracting #HospitalityIndustry #EventManagement #Retailers #OutsourcingServices
